questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. According to the routing table, where will the router send a packet destined for 10.1.5.65?
//IMG//

discussion.content: The destination IP address 10.1.5.65 belongs to 10.1.5.64/28, 10.1.5.64/29 & 10.1.5.64/27 subnets but the “longest prefix match” algorithm will choose the most specific subnet mask -> the prefix “/29? will be chosen to route the packet. Therefore the next-hop should be 10.1.3.3
The highest IP address of all loopback interfaces will be chosen -> Loopback 0 will be chosen as the router ID.
OSPF Procees ID start from 1 - 65535. B is wrong. A&D is correct as shown.

The correct answer is B 
and D

questions.question_text: Which commands are required to properly configure a router to run OSPF and to add network 192.168.16.0/24 to OSPF area 0? (Choose two.)

questions.answer_description: For the 192.168.20.24/29 network, the usable hosts are 192.168.24.25 (router) ?192.168.24.30 (used for the sales server).

discussion.content:
The CIDR /29 is equivalent to 255.255.255.248, meaning there's 8 subnet hosts available. The first IP is reserved for the network address 192.168.20.24 (Given). The last IP is reserved for the Broadcast address, which is 192.168.20.31. 

Therefore, the last available host IP base on this subnet is 192.168.20.30. 
Answer is C

choices.D: The IP address that is configured on S0/0 of RouterB is not in the correct subnet.
choices.B: Interface S0/0 on RouterB is administratively down.
choices.E: Interface S0/0 on RouterA is not receiving a clock signal from the CSU/DSU.
choices.F: The encapsulation that is configured on S0/0 of RouterB does not match the encapsulation that is configured on S0/0 of RouterA.
choices.C: Interface S0/0 on RouterA is configured with an incorrect subnet mask.
choices.A: The cable that is connected to S0/0 on RouterA is faulty.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
Hosts in network 192.168.2.0 are unable to reach hosts in network 192.168.3.0.
Based on the output from RouterA, what are two possible reasons for the failure?(Choose two)
//IMG//

discussion.content: Other sites have the right interfaces and IPs that make this question make sense. All you really need to know is that the second interface is Serial 0/0.
